technical_features.source_sentence: The corresponding green-emitting electroluminescence devices exhibited a maximum EQE of 12.74%, along with a luminance of over 175 000 cd m⁻² and a long T₅₀@100 cd m⁻² lifetime of over 20 000 h.
The corresponding green-emitting electroluminescence devices exhibited a maximum EQE of 12.74%, along with a luminance of over 175 000 cd m⁻² and a long T₅₀@100 cd m⁻² lifetime of over 20 000 h.
The corresponding green-emitting electroluminescence devices exhibited a maximum EQE of 12.74%, along with a luminance of over 175 000 cd m⁻² and a long T₅₀@100 cd m⁻² lifetime of over 20 000 h.
The resultant InP/ZnSe/ZnS core/shell QDs demonstrated a high PL QY of 91%.
The resultant InP/ZnSe/ZnS core/shell QDs demonstrated a high PL QY of 91%.
QDs with ZnMy₂ demonstrate an improved optical property with a high PLQY of 91% and an FWHM of 44 nm.
The average size for the as-prepared core/shell/shell QD with ZnMy₂ is estimated to be 8.1 ± 1.0 nm with better size distribution.
The device with ZnMy₂ exhibits a smaller turn-on voltage (2.0 V) than that of the device without ZnMy₂ (2.2 V).
The corresponding green-emitting electroluminescence devices exhibited a maximum EQE of 12.74%, along with a luminance of over 175 000 cd m⁻² and a long T₅₀@100 cd m⁻² lifetime of over 20 000 h.

The area ratio of P–O decreases from 33% for the InP core without ZnMy₂ to 14% for that with ZnMy₂, indicating that ZnMy₂ can react with the surface of InP core and inhibit the development of the InPOₓ surface oxide layer.

qualitative_insights.main_objective: Improve the efficiency and stability of green InP-based quantum dot light-emitting diodes (QLEDs) through in-situ passivation of InP core surfaces with zinc myristate (ZnMy₂)
qualitative_insights.key_methodology_summary: Fluoride-free synthesis strategy where ZnMy₂ reacts with phosphine dangling bonds on InP cores to form a Zn-P protective layer, followed by ZnSe/ZnS shell growth to reduce surface oxidation and defects
primary_findings_conclusions: Achieved 91% photoluminescence quantum yield (PL QY) in InP/ZnSe/ZnS QDs
QLEDs demonstrated 12.74% maximum external quantum efficiency (EQE)
Record luminance of 175,084 cd/m² for green InP-based QLEDs
future_work_suggested_by_authors: Further performance improvements for green InP-based QLED commercialization
qualitative_insights.novelty_significance_claim: First demonstration of fluoride-free ZnMy₂ treatment for InP core passivation, enabling safer synthesis and superior device performance compared to HF-based methods
qualitative_insights.key_tables_figures_present: Figure 3 (device performance metrics), Table 1 (summary of QLED parameters including EQE, luminance, and lifetime)
